death_place.zh-cn: 日本红十字会医疗中心

description.zh-cn: 日本皇族与海军军人，大正天皇与贞明皇后的第三皇子，昭和天皇的弟弟。他以在第二次世界大战期间持鲜明的反战立场而闻名，并与多位政治人物组成和平联盟，甚至考虑刺杀东条英机。战后曾担任日本红十字会会长。
description.en: A Japanese imperial prince and naval officer, the third son of Emperor Taishō and Empress Teimei, and the younger brother of Emperor Shōwa. He was known for his clear anti-war stance during World War II, forming a peace alliance with several politicians and even considering the assassination of Hideki Tojo. After the war, he served as president of the Japanese Red Cross Society.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王之妻，末代幕府大将军德川庆喜的孙女，有栖川宫威仁亲王的外孙女。
description.en: Wife of Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito, granddaughter of the last shōgun Tokugawa Yoshinobu, and maternal granddaughter of Prince Arisugawa Takehito.

description.zh-cn: 日本第123代天皇，高松宫宣仁亲王的父亲。
description.en: The 123rd Emperor of Japan, father of Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇的皇后，高松宫宣仁亲王的母亲。
description.en: Empress consort of Emperor Taishō, mother of Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito.

description.zh-cn: 日本第124代天皇，高松宫宣仁亲王的长兄。
description.en: The 124th Emperor of Japan, the elder brother of Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito.

description.zh-cn: 日本江户幕府第15代征夷大将军，也是末代将军。其孙女喜久子是高松宫宣仁亲王的妻子。
description.en: The 15th and last shōgun of the Tokugawa shogunate of Japan. His granddaughter, Kikuko, was the wife of Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito.

description.zh-cn: 有栖川宫第10代当主。在他去世且继承人断绝后，大正天皇为表彰其功绩，让第三皇子宣仁亲王创立高松宫以继承其祭祀。
description.en: The 10th head of the Arisugawa-no-miya house. After his death and the lack of an heir, Emperor Taishō, recognizing his merits, had his third son, Prince Nobuhito, establish the Takamatsu-no-miya to succeed its rites.

description.zh-cn: 二战期间的日本首相和陆军大将，是战争的主要推动者之一。高松宫宣仁亲王曾考虑刺杀他。
description.en: Prime Minister and General of the Imperial Japanese Army during World War II, one of the main proponents of the war. Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito considered assassinating him.

description.zh-cn: 二战期间的日本海军大臣，高松宫宣仁亲王因其主战立场而主张他辞职。
description.en: Minister of the Navy of Japan during World War II, whom Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito advocated to resign due to his pro-war stance.

description.zh-cn: 日本皇族，战后曾短暂担任首相。二战期间是皇室和平派成员，与高松宫宣仁亲王一同反对扩大战争。
description.en: A member of the Japanese imperial family who briefly served as prime minister after the war. During WWII, he was a member of the imperial family's peace faction and opposed the expansion of the war alongside Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇第四皇子，高松宫宣仁亲王的弟弟。二战期间是皇室和平派成员，与高松宫宣仁亲王一同反对扩大战争。
description.en: The fourth son of Emperor Taishō and younger brother of Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito. During WWII, he was a member of the imperial family's peace faction and opposed the expansion of the war alongside Prince Takamatsu.

description.zh-cn: 日本前首相及海军大将。二战期间是和平派，与高松宫宣仁亲王等人组成反对扩大战争联盟。
description.en: A former Prime Minister and admiral in the Imperial Japanese Navy. He was part of the peace faction during WWII and formed an alliance to oppose the expansion of the war with Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito and others.

description.zh-cn: 日本前首相。二战期间，他加入了由高松宫宣仁亲王等人组成的反对扩大战争联盟。
description.en: A former Prime Minister of Japan. During WWII, he joined the alliance formed by Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito and others to oppose the expansion of the war.

description.zh-cn: 日本战后重要首相。二战期间是爱好和平的政治人物，与高松宫宣仁亲王等人组成反对扩大战争联盟。
description.en: An important post-war Prime Minister of Japan. During WWII, he was a peace-loving politician who formed an alliance with Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito and others to oppose the expansion of the war.

description.zh-cn: 日本皇室的宫家之一，由大正天皇第三皇子宣仁亲王于1913年创立，以继承已断绝的旧宫家有栖川宫的祭祀。
description.en: One of the princely houses of the Imperial House of Japan, founded in 1913 by Prince Nobuhito, the third son of Emperor Taishō, to succeed the rites of the extinct Arisugawa-no-miya house.

description.zh-cn: 大日本帝国的海军武装力量。高松宫宣仁亲王曾在其中服役，最高军阶为海军大佐。
description.en: The naval armed force of the Empire of Japan. Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito served in it, reaching the rank of Captain.

description.zh-cn: 日本的国家级红十字会组织。高松宫宣仁亲王于1945年至1948年间担任会长。
description.en: The national Red Cross society of Japan. Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito served as its president from 1945 to 1948.

nodes.id: 日本红十字会医疗中心

zh-cn: 日本红十字会医疗中心

description.zh-cn: 位于东京涩谷的医疗机构，高松宫宣仁亲王于此病逝。
description.en: A medical institution in Shibuya, Tokyo, where Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito passed away.

description.zh-cn: 为大日本帝国海军培养军官的学校。高松宫宣仁亲王于1920年至1924年在此就读。
description.en: An academy established to train officers for the Imperial Japanese Navy. Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito studied here from 1920 to 1924.

description.zh-cn: 大日本帝国海军的参谋学院。高松宫宣仁亲王于1934年至1936年在此就读。
description.en: The staff college of the Imperial Japanese Navy. Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito studied here from 1934 to 1936.

description.zh-cn: 日本皇室的宫家之一，因继承人断绝而终结。其祭祀由新设立的高松宫继承。
description.en: One of the princely houses of the Imperial House of Japan, which became extinct due to a lack of an heir. Its rites were succeeded by the newly established Takamatsu-no-miya.

description.zh-cn: 一场全球性的战争。高松宫宣仁亲王在此期间持鲜明的反战立场。
description.en: A global war. During this period, Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito held a strong anti-war stance.

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战太平洋战场的一场关键海战。此次战败后，高松宫宣仁亲王开始积极致力于结束战争。
description.en: A crucial naval battle in the Pacific Theater of World War II. After this defeat, Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito began to actively work towards ending the war.

description.zh-cn: 日本皇太子的官方居所，高松宫宣仁亲王的出生地。
description.en: The official residence of the Crown Prince of Japan, and the birthplace of Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王于1930年2月4日与德川庆喜的孙女喜久子结婚。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito married Kikuko, the granddaughter of Tokugawa Yoshinobu, on February 4, 1930.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王是大正天皇的第三皇子。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito was the third son of Emperor Taishō.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王是贞明皇后的第三皇子。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito was the third son of Empress Teimei.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王是昭和天皇的弟弟。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito was the younger brother of Emperor Shōwa.

description.zh-cn: 宣仁亲王妃喜久子是德川庆喜的孙女。
description.en: Princess Kikuko was the granddaughter of Tokugawa Yoshinobu.

description.zh-cn: 宣仁亲王妃喜久子是有栖川宫威仁亲王的外孙女。
description.en: Princess Kikuko was the maternal granddaughter of Prince Arisugawa Takehito.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王于1905年1月3日出生于青山东宫御所。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito was born on January 3, 1905, at the Aoyama Tōgū Palace.

description.zh-cn: 有鉴于有栖川宫威仁亲王等人的功绩，大正天皇于1913年册封其三皇子宣仁亲王为高松宫，以继承有栖川宫的祭祀。
description.en: In recognition of the merits of Prince Arisugawa Takehito and others, Emperor Taishō created the Takamatsu-no-miya for his third son, Prince Nobuhito, in 1913, to succeed the rites of the Arisugawa-no-miya.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫的设立是为了继承因继承人断绝而终结的有栖川宫的祭祀。
description.en: The Takamatsu-no-miya was established to succeed the rites of the Arisugawa-no-miya, which had become extinct due to a lack of an heir.

description.zh-cn: 宣仁亲王于1913年被赐立为高松宫，成为该宫家的第一代当主。
description.en: Prince Nobuhito was established as the Prince Takamatsu in 1913, becoming the first head of this princely house.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王曾加入大日本帝国海军，最高军阶为海军大佐。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito joined the Imperial Japanese Navy, reaching the highest rank of Captain.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王于1920年进入海军兵学校预科，1924年毕业。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito entered the preparatory course of the Imperial Japanese Naval Academy in 1920 and graduated in 1924.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王于1934年进入海军大学校，1936年毕业。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito entered the Naval War College in 1934 and graduated in 1936.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王于1945年7月至1948年7月担任日本红十字会会长。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito served as the president of the Japanese Red Cross Society from July 1945 to July 1948.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王在第二次世界大战期间持鲜明的反战立场，并与多位政治人物组成反对扩大战争的联盟。
description.en: During World War II, Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito held a strong anti-war stance and formed an alliance with several politicians to oppose the expansion of the war.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王反对东条英机推动战争的政策，甚至一度考虑与亲信合作刺杀他。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito opposed Hideki Tojo's policy of promoting war and even considered assassinating him with his confidants.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王反对时任海军大臣嶋田繁太郎的主战立场，并频密主张其辞职。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito opposed the pro-war stance of then-Navy Minister Shigetarō Shimada and frequently advocated for his resignation.

description.zh-cn: 1944年夏前后，因在战争政策上公然唱反调，高松宫宣仁亲王与长兄昭和天皇意见持续相左，导致二人关系恶化。
description.en: Around the summer of 1944, due to his public opposition to war policies, Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito had ongoing disagreements with his elder brother, Emperor Shōwa, leading to a deterioration in their relationship.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王与同为皇族和平派的东久迩宫稔彦王等人组成反对扩大战争联盟。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito, along with fellow imperial peace faction member Prince Higashikuni Naruhiko and others, formed an alliance to oppose the expansion of the war.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王与弟弟、同为皇族和平派的三笠宫崇仁亲王等人组成反对扩大战争联盟。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito, along with his younger brother and fellow imperial peace faction member Prince Mikasa Takahito and others, formed an alliance to oppose the expansion of the war.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王与前首相米内光政等海军左派人物组成反对扩大战争联盟。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito, along with former Prime Minister Mitsumasa Yonai and other leftist figures in the navy, formed an alliance to oppose the expansion of the war.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王与前首相近卫文麿等爱好和平的政治人物组成反对扩大战争联盟。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito, along with former Prime Minister Fumimaro Konoe and other peace-loving politicians, formed an alliance to oppose the expansion of the war.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王与战后担任首相的吉田茂等爱好和平的政治人物组成反对扩大战争联盟。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito, along with Shigeru Yoshida, who later became prime minister, and other peace-loving politicians, formed an alliance to oppose the expansion of the war.

description.zh-cn: 在中途岛战役战败后，高松宫宣仁亲王开始更加积极地努力结束战争。
description.en: After the defeat in the Battle of Midway, Prince Takamatsu Nobuhito began to work more actively to end the war.
